ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Lo! Man is in a state of loss;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: the human being is doomed to suffer loss,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed man is surely in a loss.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Most surely man is in loss,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely Man is in the way of loss,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! man is a state of loss,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: that man is surely in a state of loss,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Surely, the human is in a (state of) loss,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The human being is in loss.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [103:2] Verily man (al-insān: the generic) is in [a state of] loss, in all his bargaining,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! Man) i.e. the disbelieving man (is in a state of loss) and torment because of losing his family and position in Paradise; it is also said this means: he is in a state of loss because of decrease in his works in old age and its cessation after death,
